(TODO: Put my photo here)

# Projects and Experience
---

## World Crisis Database
* Time: December, 2013
* Repository: Private, ask me for permission!
* Link: [Heroku](http://cs373wcdb.herokuapp.com/)
* Description:

  An app that emulates [IMDB](http://www.imdb.com/) in displaying worldwide crises and related people and organizations.

  It implements a [RESTful](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) API for connecting to and retrieving data from the server.
  (TODO: Write more about what I did, even post code sample or photos)
* Tools and Languages:
  * [Python](http://www.python.org/)
  * [Django](https://www.djangoproject.com/)
  * [Heroku](https://www.heroku.com/)
  * [AngularJS](http://angularjs.org/)
  * [Bootstrap](http://getbootstrap.com/)

## FTP Server and Client
* Time: May, 2013
* Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/kevinleeone/ftp)
* Description:

  It is a class project for Computer Networks. I implemented it in Python 3.3 and strictly according to [RFC 959](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc959). Though it does not offer a GUI, it supports the most essential, but not all, features of the RFC. It even supports different network layers, including IPv4 and IPv6, and the server has support for multitasking, allowing it to respond to different clients at the same time.
* Tools and Languages:
  * [Python](http://www.python.org/)
